message: So, waiting for somebody else to come here...
Hello - and - there was an IRC channel?
that was my reaction as well.  I notice it was linked on the website but I never noticed it
Heh, yeah - its been around for a while.
I generally idle it in and people pop in now and then but its fairly quiet - probably due to me not really advertising it :)
Convore could be ideal for user groups - somewhere between mailing lists and IRC.
It has some of the advantages of each but it is also another site to visit
@judy2k I used to use xchat in Ubuntu and I think there is a Windows version. It's alright but I never liked it that much.
Can anyone recommend a good IRC client for Windoze?
Hmm. I started downloading mIRC before I realised that it's commercial. To add insult to injury it's distributed with adware. Scumbags.
I've been using pidgin.  It seems fine to me but I don't use IRC heavily and don't have much experience with other clients
That's an idea - especially as I already have Pidgen installed
Sorry - Pidgin - I always spell it with an 'e' for some reason...
I frequently pronounce it with an e so I suspect an easy mistake to make.  I see you've found the irc channel
